textBox.richText: Around this time, I started attending Hacker School. So when the NYRR decided to stonewall me, I decided to hack them. Ok. Not really “hack” but more like “take advantage of the fact that all their race data is just a few clicks away.” So, with the help of another Hacker Schooler, I wrote my first scraper. I decided to write it in python using the scrapy framework. I’d played a bit with python in grad school but mostly to write tiny data analysis scripts and never for anything major - certainly never for anything that involved sending requests over the internet! Luckily my python scripts worked and after passing “self” around a few dozen times and I finally managed to get the thing going. In the end, I scraped all the race results from the late 80s all the way up to July 2012. The data was a bit of a mess, so of course I spent quite a bit of time cleaning it up. Then, of course, I had to figure out what to do with this massive CSV file. Ok. Not massive, but there are some 2,000,000 + rows in my CSV file. It was time to learn something about databases.... I ended up settling on a MySQL database, for no particularly good reason other than my data was all relational and I could use the pretty Sequel Pro app. Here’s my personal data through July 2012, for example.
